00048 /*****************************************************************************\
00049  *      File :          l_main.c
00050  *      Description :   Main program for LCODE environment.
00051  *      Author: Po-hua Chang, Wen-mei Hwu
00052  *      Creation Date:  June 1990
00053 \*****************************************************************************/
00054 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00055 #include <config.h>
00056 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00057 
00058 /* On HPUX, print out memory usage when module gets huge */
00059 #ifndef __WIN32__
00060 #ifdef _HPUX_SOURCE
00061 #include <sys/param.h>
00062 #include <sys/pstat.h>
00063 #endif
00064 #include <unistd.h>
00065 #endif
00066 
00067 #ifdef _HPUX_SOURCE
00068 /* Prints out out memory usage to 'out' if total memory usage bigger than
00069  * min_size (in k).  Used for triming memory usage of IMPACT.
00070  */
00071 void
00072 print_mem_usage (FILE *out, double min_size)
00073 {
00074    int page_size;
00075    int text_pages;
00076    int data_pages;
00077    int stack_pages;
00078    int pid;
00079    double text_size, data_size, stack_size, total_size;
00080    struct pst_status status;
00081 
00082    /* Get the page size on this machine */
00083    page_size = getpagesize ();
00084 
00085    /* Get this process's process id */
00086    pid = getpid();
00087 
00088    /* Get the process info for this process */
00089    if (pstat_getproc(&status, sizeof (status), 0, pid) == -1)
00090    {
00091        fprintf (out, "print_mem_usage: pstat_getproc failed for pid %i!\n",
00092                  pid);
00093         return;
00094    }
00095 
00096    /* Get the number of pages used */
00097    text_pages = status.pst_vtsize;
00098    data_pages = status.pst_vdsize;
00099    stack_pages = status.pst_vssize;
00100 
00101    /* Convert to kbytes used */
00102    text_size = ((double)text_pages) * ((double)page_size) / 1024.0;
00103    data_size = ((double)data_pages) * ((double)page_size) / 1024.0;
00104    stack_size = ((double)stack_pages) * ((double)page_size) / 1024.0;
00105    total_size = text_size + data_size + stack_size;
00106 
00107    /* If total bigger than min_size, print out stats */
00108    if (total_size >= min_size)
00109    {
00110        fprintf (out, "Total memory usage: %.0fK   (Data %.0fK  "
00111                 "Stack %.0fK  Text %.0fK)\n", total_size, data_size,
00112                 stack_size, text_size);
00113    }
00114 }
00115 #endif
00116 
00117 /*
00118  *      LCODE main 
00119  */
00120 
00121 int main(int argc, char **argv, char **envp)
00122 {
00123     C_Arg arg[C_MAX_ARG];
00124     int n_arg, i, j;
00125     Parm_Macro_List *external_list;
00126     int read_i, read_o;
00127 
00128     L_ERR = stderr;
00129 
00130 #ifndef __WIN32__
00131     /*
00132      * Determine max data segment size
00133      */
00134     L_data_segment_start = sbrk(0);
00135 #endif
00136     
00137     /* 
00138      * Initialize these string defaults using strdup since 
00139      * they are run-time configurable and may be malloced/freed
00140      * (They are no longer freed, statics may be used.)
00141      */
00142     L_arch = "impact";
00143     L_model = "v1.0";
00144     L_input_file = "stdin";
00145     L_output_file = "stdout";
00146     L_filelist_file = NULL;
00147 
00148     /* save the current Lcode pass name for error messages */
00149     L_curr_pass_name = argv[0];
00150 
00151     /*
00152      * Get macro definitions from command line and environment.
00153      * This is the updated version of command_line_macro_list,
00154      * any it may be used in the same way.
00155      */
00156     external_list = L_create_external_macro_list (argv, envp);
00157     L_command_line_macro_list = external_list;  /* SAM 10-94 */
00158 
00159     /* 
00160      * Get L_parm_file from command line (-p path), or environment
00161      * variable "STD_PARMS_FILE", or default to "./STD_PARMS"
00162      */
00163     L_parm_file = L_get_std_parm_name (argv, envp, "STD_PARMS_FILE",
00164                                        "./STD_PARMS");
00165 
00166         
00167     /*
00168      * Load simulation parameters now, so that command line arguements
00169      * will override them if specified.  Pass in all command line
00170      * macro definitions.
00171      */
00172     /* Renamed 'global' to 'Lglobal' -JCG 5/26/98 */
00173     L_load_parameters_aliased (L_parm_file, external_list,  
00174                        "(Lglobal", "(global", L_read_parm_global);
00175     /* Renamed 'architecture' to 'Larchitecture' -JCG 5/26/98 */
00176     L_load_parameters_aliased (L_parm_file, external_list,  
00177                        "(Larchitecture", "(architecture", L_read_parm_arch);
00178     /* Renamed 'file' to 'Lfile' -JCG 5/26/98 */
00179     L_load_parameters_aliased (L_parm_file, external_list,  
00180                        "(Lfile", "(file", L_read_parm_file);
00181     /* 
00182      * If the first argument does not contain an -, it is
00183      * ignored by Lcode.  Punt if this is the case.
00184      */
00185     if ((argv[1] != NULL) && (argv[1][0] != '-'))
00186     {
00187         L_punt ("Unknown command line option '%s'.", 
00188                 argv[1]);
00189     }
00190 
00191     /* Mark that we have not read the input or output file yet */
00192     read_i = 0;
00193     read_o = 0;
00194 
00195     /* Process the rest of the command line arguments */
00196     n_arg = C_get_arg(argc-1, argv+1, arg, C_MAX_ARG);
00197     for (i=0; i < n_arg; i++)
00198     {
00199         char *option;
00200         option = arg[i].option;
00201 
00202         /* Get input file name */
00203         if (! strcmp(option, "-i")) 
00204         {
00205             /* Punt if input file specified twice */
00206             if (read_i)
00207                 L_punt ("Parsing command line: -i specified twice.\n");
00208 
00209             /* Make sure file name specified */
00210             if (arg[i].count < 1)
00211                 L_punt("Parsing command line: -i needs input_file_name.");
00212             /* Make sure that only one file name specified */
00213             if (arg[i].count > 1)
00214             {
00215                 fprintf (stderr, "Error parsing command line: -i");
00216                 for (j = 0; j < arg[i].count; j++)
00217                     fprintf (stderr, " %s", arg[i].spec[j]);
00218                 fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00219                 L_punt ("Cannot specify more than one input file with -i.");
00220             }
00221 
00222            /*
00223             L_input_file = C_findstr(arg[i].spec[0]);
00224             */
00225             L_input_file = strdup(arg[i].spec[0]);
00226 
00227             /* Mark that we have read an input file name */
00228             read_i = 1;
00229         }
00230 
00231         /* Get output file name */
00232         else if (! strcmp(option, "-o")) 
00233         {
00234             /* Punt if output file specified twice */
00235             if (read_o)
00236                 L_punt ("Parsing command line: -o specified twice.\n");
00237 
00238             /* Make sure file name specified */
00239             if (arg[i].count < 1)
00240                 L_punt("Parsing command line: -o needs output_file_name.");
00241             /* Make sure only one file name specified */
00242             if (arg[i].count > 1)
00243             {
00244                 fprintf (stderr, "Parsing command line: -o");
00245                 for (j = 0; j < arg[i].count; j++)
00246                     fprintf (stderr, " %s", arg[i].spec[j]);
00247                 fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00248                 L_punt ("Cannot specify more than one output file with -o.");
00249             }
00250 
00251             /*
00252             L_output_file = C_findstr(arg[i].spec[0]);
00253             */
00254             L_output_file = strdup(arg[i].spec[0]);
00255 
00256             /* Mark that we have read an output file */
00257             read_o = 1;
00258         } 
00259 
00260         /* Ignore -p */
00261         else if (strcmp (option, "-p") == 0)
00262             ;
00263 
00264         /* Ignore -P, -F  (and for now -D), accept to make sure there
00265          * are no argument after it.
00266          */
00267         else if ((option[0] == '-') && 
00268                  ((option[1] == 'P') || (option[1] == 'D') || 
00269                   (option[1] == 'F')))
00270         {
00271             /* Make sure there is nothing after the -Pmacro_name=val */
00272 //            L_punt("param %s",arg[i].spec[0]);
00273             if (arg[i].count > 0)
00274             {
00275                 L_punt ("Unknown command line option '%s'.", 
00276                         arg[i].spec[0]);
00277             }
00278             
00279         }
00280 
00281         /* Otherwise, punt, unknown commmand line arguments */
00282         else
00283         {
00284             /* Print out what we are punting on */
00285             fprintf (stderr, "Error parsing command line: %s", option);
00286             for (j = 0; j < arg[i].count; j++)
00287                 fprintf (stderr, " %s", arg[i].spec[j]);
00288             fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00289 
00290             L_punt ("Unknown command line option.");
00291         }
00292     }
00293 
00294     /* 
00295      * Renice this process to L_nice_value.  
00296      * Ignore the error codes that will be returned if
00297      * already reniced or L_nice_value is invalid. 
00298      */
00299 #ifndef __WIN32__
00300 /* ADA 5/29/96: Win95/NT has diffenent way to change priority but IMPACT
00301                 module running on Win95/NT doesn't really care about it */
00302     setpriority(PRIO_PROCESS, 0, L_nice_value);
00303 #endif
00304     /*
00305      *  Initialize all symbols
00306      */
00307     L_init_symbol();
00308 
00309     if (L_file_processing_model==L_FILE_MODEL_FILE)
00310        L_OUT = L_open_output_file(L_output_file);
00311 
00312     /*
00313      *  Create pools for Lcode data structs
00314      */
00315     L_setup_alloc_pools();
00316 
00317     /*
00318      *  SET UP THE ENVIRONMENT.
00319      */
00320     M_set_machine(L_arch, L_model, L_swarch);
00321     M_define_macros(L_macro_symbol_table);
00322     M_define_opcode_name(L_opcode_symbol_table);
00323 
00324     /*
00325      * Initialize intrinsic support. -ITI/JWJ 7/99
00326      */
00327     L_intrinsic_init();
00328 
00329     /*
00330      *  PROCESS INPUT.
00331      */
00332     L_gen_code(external_list);
00333 
00334 
00335     if (L_file_processing_model==L_FILE_MODEL_FILE)
00336        L_close_output_file(L_OUT);
00337 
00338     /*
00339      *  One last check of data structure allocation
00340      */
00341     if (L_check_data_struct_alloc) {
00342         L_check_alloc_for_func();
00343         L_check_alloc_for_data();
00344         /* REH 4/18/95 */
00345         L_check_alloc_for_region();
00346     }
00347 
00348     /* 
00349      * Print warning about unused command line parameter arguments if
00350      * we have actually manipulated an Lcode function.  This prevents
00351      * producing warning messages for files only containing data
00352      * segments.
00353      */
00354     if (L_func_read)
00355         L_warn_about_unused_macros (stderr, external_list);
00356 
00357     /* If on HPUX and module required more than 256 Megs, let user know */
00358 #ifdef _HPUX_SOURCE
00359     print_mem_usage (stderr, (256.0 * 1024.0));
00360 #endif
00361     return(0);
00362 }
